title: American_Top_40_1988_July_23rd
description:
"You're listening to the week's biggest hits on American Top 40; I'm Casey Kasem."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is a hit by an artist who won a Logie Award before she became a successful recording artist. Casey explains all that.

Michael Jackson was the first artist in chart history to get five #1 songs from the same album. The song that did it for him is at number 30, "Dirty Diana."

A listener wants to know what act in the rock era has hit the top 10 the most years in a row. There are three acts tied for second place at 8-years in a row, and one act with nine.

Because George Michael is at number 21 with his song "Monkey" Casey plays a medley of other monkey songs.

The Countours are at number 17 with their song, "Do You Love Me." Casey says they are a Motown act that goes back to the early 60's. He also plays a piece of one Countours' song that got the women in the audience would get so worked-up, they would throw their purses on stage!

The only artist ever to debut an album in the number one spot on the album chart TWICE has a song in this countdown.

39: I'll Always Love You - Taylor Dayne
